intro: Cynometra ramiflora subsp. genuina, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lanceolate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. It is valued for its hard, heavy wood used in furniture and musical instruments. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests.
